column4: intel 1500 mhz 512mb ram :   boot from CD , select installation ->>> Error I/O reboot. why????
First try   F6 then add noapic to the boot line.. also.. at what speed did you burn the iso?
that should be slow enough..  May I assume you did the self test for errors
which self test? the same that you have in the boot? yes i did. same error.. loading kernel .... ERROR I/O
Some hardware, especially people with ati video cards have better luck with the alternate cd but try F6 at start or install and type noapic  just before the --
ok i'm going to try noapic before the -- . i was thinking to download ubuntu feisty and then upgrade. i think that with feisty i should not have any problems.
what hardware are you running.. I just did the f to g upgrade..ugh.. 6 hours
nothing so strange.. intel 1500 mhz, 512mb ram, ati radeon 9600
before you dl again... burn a copy at 4x
i try : noapic , burn @ 4x & alternate cd. right?
I had two Dells and an Hp laptop that would not touch it unless burned dead slow
Try reburning the rw you have from the iso you have.. but very slow
